localised_description: Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!
The wizard binds the bones of predatory creatures with dark magic, causing them to rise from their animal graves.
The wizard draws tendrills of the Wind of Death into a dark fog that restores the undead and fills them with unholy vigour.
The wizard tears the souls from his victims' bodies before breathing unlife into their sundered corpses.
At the wizard's command, the ground opens up to reveal a portal through which long-dead knights ride forth to do battle.
Dwaring forth the dark energy coursing across the land, the caster send the tendrills of power seeping into the ground in search of long-dead bodies to answer his summons.
Grasping hold of his foe, the wizard pours forth the decaying power of ages, desiccating flesh, armour and bone, and reducing his victom to dust in a single heartbeat.
The greatest practitioners of the dark arts can summon forth the most fearsome champions and creatures of undeath.

The Supreme Lord of Undeath, the ultimate personification of death and the undead, an ancient, evil being who seeks to conquer this cruel, chaotic world and bring about an age of undeath that will rule for all eternity.
Rise! The Undying King commands you! Come to me!

There will be no escape, no blessed oblivion. I can end your life as easily as I can extinguish a candle, and before your corpse is cold, I can reach out and grasp your soul. You will be my slave for all eternity, and I shall laugh at the depths of your pain. Such is the power of Nagash.
The dead do not squabble as this land’s rulers do. The dead do not fight one another. The dead have no desires, no petty jealousies or ambitions. A world of the dead is a world at peace...
See the fate of all flesh and know despair!

Nagash's armour is forged from an alloy of lead and meteoric iron. Over the millennia the armour has fused itself with his body, so it may only be worn by Nagash. Obviously, the armour does not prevent him casting spells.

Mortis is a huge magic sword that crackles with unearthly power. The blade was forged and enchanted by Nagash himself and no-one else may use it. The sword increases his already considerable strength, and wounds caused by the sword can be used to heal Nagash himself.
localised_name: Mortis – The Great Blade of Death

localised_description: The Staff of Power was created by Nagash to allow him to store the additional power he needed to carry out his most arcane and dangerous magical spells.

The Crown of Sorcery sometimes known as the Crown of Nagash is a magical crown/circlet forged by the great Necromancer Nagash around -1300 IC in his fortress of Nagashizzar in Cripple Peak. The crown is infused with part of Nagash's malicious spirit, partially holding his spirit to the mortal world, and exerts a corrupting influence on anyone who wears it.

Nagash was the first and greatest of all the Necromancers, he created almost all of the spells that allow these followers of the dark arts to raise and control the Undead. The secrets of his magical spells are recorded in nine massive tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.

Although not as numerous as Settra's grand army, Arkhan's Undead legions are bolstered by the Liche King's unparalleled necromantic dexterity.
The first and most loyal of the Great Necromancer's followers will stand at his side once again. So it is written…
If anything, this one has an even greater lust for life than they did before their death.

One hundred and thirty-six of her followers have raised armies, fleets and beasts to hurl themselves against my walls. They come from north, east, south. sea, sky and sand, from the jungles and the mountains too. They pour forth in a limitless tide and they are broken on my walls.
Ancient, powerful, beautiful, seductive and cunning, traits that give the Queen of Mysteries advantage on the battlefied with both blade and tongue.

Queen of Lahmia and First of the Vampires, Neferata distiled an Elixer of Life which cursed her for all eternity. Neferata and her court became stricken by an unquenchable thirst for mortal blood. Lahmia became the birthplace of the Vampires.
You are a greater fool than even I believed, and never shall you join my kin. We are guests at the ultimate masquerade, and your kind is simply not invited.
Behind every great man is a great woman. And behind those great women is me.
If there's duty to be paid, rest assured that this one will find a way around it.
Fire, to destroy all that you have done; fire, to end all you've become.
Some seafarers appear to have been born for the role.
By which death is expertly dealt, assuming it doesn't blow your hand off in the process!
His crimes are without number and his villainy without end… behold the Pirate King!
Created by the Arch-Necromancer, the staff harnesses Dark Magic from deep within the accursed Black Pyramid.
The sword burns away the flesh of Arkhan's victims, leaving nothing but a charred skeleton, bound to the Liche King's dark will for all eternity.
This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.
An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.
The Lord of the von Carsteins exudes a distracting and sensational air, giving all before him pause.
It is well known that Lustrian gold is enchanted with all manner of esoteric properties; Harkon thinks it will restore his fractured mind!
The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
To me, my winged steed of bone and flesh; let us fly and remake the world together!
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Mannfred can ride an armoured steed of defiled flesh and bone; such an abominable horse is known as a 'Nightmare'.
Neferata can ride an armoured steed of defiled flesh and bone; such an abominable horse is known as a 'Nightmare'.
Harkon's personal mount is a dreadful thing indeed - a Terrorgheist with a piercing, banshee-like shriek that has the power to stun any who hear it.
This one is no apprentice in the black arts but a master of Necromancy and Dark Magic.
Nagash, known by many names such as the Great Necromancer, the Great Betrayer, the Usurper, the Undying King, the Lord of Undead, He Who Shall Not Be Named or simply Bone Daddy.

Once Divine warriors of Ptra, the Hammurai failed in their task of defeating The Supreme Lord of the Undead, Nagash looked upon their corpses of the hammurai and saw opportunity. Thus the Heralds of Accursed One were born.

The greatest of their number, the Archai - Nagash's elite guard who had been fused from the mightiest of Ptra's heralds have been encased in Ebon-wrought armour to channel the magic of the world into their accursed forms.

Only Nagash's closest lieutenants can command them; only the mightiest heroes of the mortal races have the power to defeat them. Where they tread, the living perish and the dead awaken. The morghasts are rising, and they are the heralds of death.
Wherever the morghasts fought, they brought the gift of oblivion. The morghasts had no command of sorcery, but so suffused with death magic were they that their mere presence urged the dead to rise.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
